description.narrative: Stakeholder effects: IFC's financing will sustain the Company's ability to maintain operations and be in a better position to deliver goods and services to the commercial vehicles and railways segments during the recovery period as the crisis abates. IFC's financing will also help to preserve more than 1,700 direct jobs as well as indirect jobs across the supply chain during crisis. Resilience: The proposed investment promotes the resilience of the Company through supporting the sustainability of domestic manufacturing of forging components at competitive prices, supplying the essential products to the economy-critical industries such as commercial vehicles and railways.

The proposed investment is by way of (a) subscription to unlisted, secured non-convertible debentures (NCDs) up to INR1,100 million (equivalent to US$14.6 million) issued by Ramkrishna Forgings Limited (RKFL or the Company), and (b) at IFCs option, subscription to NCDs and/or an equity/quasi equity instrument, aggregating up to INR400 million (equivalent to US$5.3 million), issued by the Company (the Project). The Project will finance the Companys long-term working capital requirements, maintenance capex and other general corporate purposes at its existing facilities in India and provide a much-needed liquidity during the COVID-19 crisis, which will enable a swift recovery once operations ramp up. RKFL, an existing IFC client, was established in 1981 and is one of the leading forged component manufacturers in India supplying to major manufacturers of commercial vehicles and to the railway sectors. The Company operates six manufacturing plants in the states of Jharkhand and West Bengal.
